title: San Francisco Bathrooms
name: San Francisco Bathrooms
description:
A Map by Bailey

Gender Neutral Bathrooms in San Francisco. From safe2pee.org. Please add new bathrooms there.

properties.description: Posted by Bailey 483 Guerrero Street, SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94110-1020Access: NoType: GenderFreeAvail: if the right person is workingIn the back past the register. It\'s on the street level, but not so wheelchair accessible because the door entry way is small.I\'ve heard them say for customers only
Posted by Bailey3296 22nd St, SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94110-3033Access: YesType: GenderFreeAvail: Not unsureThey love their G/N bathrooms!
Posted by Bailey201 Powell St., SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94102-2205Access: YesType: GenderFreeAvail: stroll right inStraight to the back of the store (left of the counter).

Posted by Bailey1525 Pine, SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94109-4611Access: NoType: GenderFreeAvail: Not unsureinside the resturant grubsteak, next to tattoo shoptwo genderfree bathrooms, for customers only,but the guys there are nice and i bet they wouldn\'t mind if you used it, puls it gets busy and i think not alot of them would even know.

properties.name: 465 South Van Ness
properties.description: Posted by Bailey465 South Van Ness, SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94103-3629Access: YesType: GenderFreeAvail: stroll right inwhen you walk in, it\'s to the left and in the back room.rad san francisco feminist/queer art gallery and performance space. www.feminapotens.com/

properties.name: Atlas Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bailey 3049 20th St, San Francisco, CAAccess: YesType: GenderFreeAvail: stroll right inThere are two genderfree single-stall bathrooms with locking doors and their own sinks in the cafe. One is on the left past the long counter, the other off of the back patio.http://www.atlascafe.net/ It\'s easier to stroll in and out when it is busy, which it often is.

properties.name: LGBT Community Center
properties.description: Posted by Bailey1800 Market St., SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94102-6227Access: YesType: GenderFreeAvail: Not unsureGender-free bathroom downstairs requires user to get a key from the front desk. The building also has signes posted about all bathrooms being free to use regardless of gender-expression, or something like that.(...but who knows what that means.) I feel like it would be good to have a way to edit things/leave comments (because this one *has* already been added), and also, I don\'t know, to ask the users to specify more about the different types of bathrooms.

properties.name: supperclub
properties.description: Posted by Bailey657 harrison street, SAN FRANCISCO, CA, 94107-1312Access: NoType: GenderFreeAvail: admission requiredsingle stall, locking genderfree bathroom rigfht next to the gendered bathrooms in the first room after the lobby. This venue is terrible and you should probably avoid it if you are not fond of Marina yuppies, str8 dudes who take up too much space, and rude service and ridiculously priced food and drinks. However, if you find yourself there for a completely random special event, the joy of your evening will be the fact that you can pee in peace. The bathroom, in fact, was even safer than the dance floor!
